medical_history.chief_complaint: Subacute onset of recent memory and speech disturbance.
medical_history.history_of_present_illness: Symptoms began subacutely; the patient experienced generalized convulsion at age 23 with cerebral CT scans showing bilateral basal ganglia calcification. During admission, she developed dysarthria, dysphasia, and mild dementia. There was also an observed progression of muscle atrophy in the limbs.
medical_history.past_medical_history: Generalized convulsion at age 23 and bilateral sensorineural hearing loss at age 26.
medical_history.family_history: Sister died suddenly at the age of 19.
